definitions.body: :Is 41:15 threshing-sledge (NH id.; Targum id., S.Ar. nawrajun, nayrajun, Fr?:133, cf. Ba:ZA ii.117 (loan-word in Ar. = ploughshare) ; mod. mawraj Dozy:ii. 623, and nawrajun Wetzst:Z.für Ethnol. 1873, 270 ff., Anderlind:ZPV ix. 41 f. (ploughshare and harrow,));—abs. ´[[מ]] Is 41:l5; pl. [[מׂדִגִּים]] 2Sa 24:22 (+ [[כְּלֵי הַבָּקָר]]); [[מוֹרִגִּים]] 1Ch 21:23; —threshing-sledges of Araunah, given by him to David for wood of sacrifice 2Sa 24:22 = 1Ch 21:23; fig. of Israel as instr. of ´[[י]]'s judgment Is 41:15. On form of threshing-sledge (mod.; slightly turned up in front, and set with sharp stones or pieces of iron), and threshing-rollers, v. Benz:Arch. 209 f. Now:Arch. i. 232 f. Dr:Amos, 227 f.
